column1: // The tool is used with the command: java -jar TestFileGenerator.jar <filespec>
// The format of this file is as follows:
// * lines beginning with '//', blank lines, and the header line beginning with
// * If the first line begins with 'PARMS', the rest of the line contains parameters for the run.
//   The output path can be specified as parameter.
// * A line containing a single word followed by '
column5: ' starts a new module.

column1: // * The tool can generate multiple modules from one input file.
// * The class name is generated from the module name and the contents of the first and
//   second columns. When this combination changes, you get a new portlet.
// The tool recognizes duplicate test case names. You should make sure that there are none.

column5: Description
The ResourceRequest object isAsyncSupported() method returns false if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object isAsyncStarted() method returns false if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object startAsync() method throws an IllegalStateException if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object startAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method throws an IllegalStateException if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.REQUEST within the resource method if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object getPortletAsyncContext() method returns the value null if the portlet does not support async processing
The ResourceRequest object isAsyncSupported() method returns true if the portlet supports async processing
The ResourceRequest object isAsyncStarted() method returns false if asynchronous processing has not been started
The ResourceRequest object isAsyncStarted() method returns true if asynchronous processing has been started
The ResourceRequest object startAsync() method returns a PortletAsyncContext object
The ResourceRequest object startAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method returns a PortletAsyncContext object
The ResourceRequest object startAsync() method throws an IllegalStateException if asynchronous processing has already been started
The ResourceRequest object startAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method throws an IllegalStateException if asynchronous processing has already been started

The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.REQUEST within the resource method before the container dispatch cycle in which asynchronous processing is started returns

The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.REQUEST within the resource filter before the container dispatch cycle in which asynchronous processing is started returns

The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.ASYNC within the resource method when the PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method is used to dispatch to the resource method

The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.ASYNC within the resource filter when the PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method is used to dispatch to the resource method

The ResourceRequest object getDispatcherType() method returns the value DispatcherType.ASYNC within the dispatch target method when the PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method is used to dispatch to the resource method
The ResourceRequest object getPortletAsyncContext() method returns the value null if async processing has not been started
The ResourceRequest object getPortletAsyncContext() method returns a PortletAsyncContext object if async processing has been started
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method completes asynchronous processing within the original resource request
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method completes asynchronous processing within an asynchronous thread
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method throws an IllegalStateException if called before asynchronous processing has started
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method throws an IllegalStateException if called after asynchronous processing has completed
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method throws an IllegalStateException if called after the PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method has been called
The PortletAsyncContext object complete() method throws an IllegalStateException if called after the PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method has been called
The PortletAsyncContext object setTimeout() method sets the asynchronous timeout value
The PortletAsyncContext object getTimeout() method returns the default value of 30000 ms
The PortletAsyncContext object getTimeout() method returns a previously set timeout value
The PortletAsyncContext object hasOriginalRequestAndResponse() method returns true if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync() method

The PortletAsyncContext object hasOriginalRequestAndResponse() method returns true if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were not wrapped

The PortletAsyncContext object hasOriginalRequestAndResponse() method returns false if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were wrapped
The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceRequest() method returns the original ResourceRequest object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync() method

The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceRequest() method returns the original ResourceRequest object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were not wrapped

The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceRequest() method returns the wrapped ResourceRequest object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were wrapped
The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceResponse() method returns the original ResourceResponse object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync() method

The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceResponse() method returns the original ResourceResponse object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were not wrapped

The PortletAsyncContext object getResourceResponse() method returns the wrapped  ResourceResponse object if asynchronous processing was started through the startPortletAsync(ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method if the request and response objects were wrapped
The PortletAsyncContext object createPortletAsyncListener(Class) method returns an instance of the PortletAsyncListener class provided
The PortletAsyncContext object createPortletAsyncListener(Class) method throws a PortletException if the class provided is not of type PortletAsyncListener
The PortletAsyncContext object createPortletAsyncListener(Class) method throws a PortletException if the class provided cannot be instantiated
The PortletAsyncContext object createPortletAsyncListener(Class) method throws a PortletException if the class provided does not have a zero argument constructor
The PortletAsyncContext object addListener(PortletAsyncListener) method adds a portlet asynchronous listener

The PortletAsyncContext object addListener(PortletAsyncListener) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after the container-initiated dispatch during which one of the startAsync() methods was called has returned to the container
The PortletAsyncContext object addListener(PortletAsyncListener, ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method adds a portlet asynchronous listener

The PortletAsyncContext object addListener(PortletAsyncListener, ResourceRequest, ResourceResponse) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after the container-initiated dispatch during which one of the startAsync() methods was called has returned to the container
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method dispatches to the resource method if called from within the original resource request
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method dispatches to the resource method if called from within an asynchronous thread
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method throws an IllegalStateException if called before a new asynchronous processing cycle has been started
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method throws an IllegalStateException if called after asynchronous processing has completed
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch() method throws an IllegalStateException if called after a dispatch method has been called within the same container dispatch cycle
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method dispatches to the given path if called from within the original resource request
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method dispatches to the given path if called from within an asynchronous thread
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called before a new asynchronous processing cycle has been started
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after asynchronous processing has completed
The PortletAsyncContext object dispatch(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after a dispatch method has been called within the same container dispatch cycle
The PortletAsyncContext object start(String) method causes an asynchronous thread to run
The PortletAsyncContext object start(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called before a new asynchronous processing cycle has been started
The PortletAsyncContext object start(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after asynchronous processing has completed
The PortletAsyncContext object start(String) method throws an IllegalStateException if called after a dispatch method has been called within the same container dispatch cycle
When CDI is available and the asynchronous thread is started through the PortletAsyncContext object, the asynchronous thread runs in the same context as the original request
When CDI is available and the asynchronous thread is started through the PortletAsyncContext object, the PortletAsyncListener runs in the same context as the original request
When CDI is available and the asynchronous thread is started through the PortletAsyncContext object, the resource filter runs in the same context as the original request
The PortletAsyncListener object onTimeout(PortletAsyncEvent) method is called when a timeout occurs
The PortletAsyncListener object onError(PortletAsyncEvent) method is called if an exception is thrown in an asynchronous thread started through the PortletAsyncContext object
The PortletAsyncListener object onComplete(PortletAsyncEvent) method is called when asynchronous processing completes
The PortletAsyncListener object onStartAsync(PortletAsyncEvent) method is called when asynchronous processing is restarted
The PortletAsyncEvent object getPortletAsyncContext() method returns the PortletAsyncContext object for the request
The PortletAsyncEvent object getSuppliedRequest() method returns null if no resource request was supplied when the PortletAsyncListener was added
The PortletAsyncEvent object getSuppliedRequest() method returns the supplied request if a resource request was supplied when the PortletAsyncListener was added
The PortletAsyncEvent object getSuppliedResponse() method returns null if no resource response was supplied when the PortletAsyncListener was added
The PortletAsyncEvent object getSuppliedResponse() method returns the supplied response if a resource response was supplied when the PortletAsyncListener was added
The PortletAsyncEvent object getThrowable() method returns null within the PortletAsyncListener object onComplete(), onTimeout(), and onStartAsync() methods
The PortletAsyncEvent object getThrowable() method returns the Throwable object associated with the error within the PortletAsyncListener object onError() method
